availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James George and Elizabeth George. Married to Sarah Perkins George in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on April 15, 1841. Father of Semiramis George. Married to Mary George. Father of George Ann George, Giles George, Mary George, Sarah George, Sophronia George, Fredonia George, and J. L. George. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 302A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 99.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 474A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 282.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Administration Bonds, Administration Bonds, 1863-1878, p. 547 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com on May 27, 2020).
Find A Grave, "Jesse George (1817-1877)," Memorial #26523657, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26523657 (accessed May 27, 2020).
